Package com.lutw.reports.controller

Class SettingsController

java.lang.Object
com.lutw.reports.controller.SettingsController
@Controller
@RequestMapping("/settings")
public class SettingsController
extends java.lang.Object
Controller class for the settings page that manages the database backup and restore requests

    • addCurrentBackupFiles

      @ModelAttribute public void addCurrentBackupFiles​(org.springframework.ui.Model model) throws java.io.IOException
      Method that automatically adds a list of the current database backup files to any request
      Parameters:
      model - Model object accessed by the view
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the backup folder can't be accessed

    • settingsView

      @RequestMapping("") public java.lang.String settingsView()
      Request mapping for the settings page
      Returns:
      the name of the settings view

    • backup

      @PostMapping("/backup") public java.lang.String backup​(org.springframework.ui.Model model, @RequestParam java.lang.String backup, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Post mapping to the settings page that creates a database backup
      Parameters:
      model - Model object accessed by the view
      backup - placeholder for desired filename
      redirectAttributes - object that holds view data in redirects
      Returns:
      a redirect to the settings page with a response attribute
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when an error occurs creating the backup

    • restore

      @PostMapping("/restore") public java.lang.String restore​(org.springframework.ui.Model model, @RequestParam java.lang.String filePath, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Post mapping to the settings page that restores the database from a backup file
      Parameters:
      model - Model object that holds attributes to be accessed by the view
      filePath - the file to attempt to restore from
      redirectAttributes - object that holds attributes sent on redirect
      Returns:
      a redirect to the settings page
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when an error occurs attempting to restore the database

    • handleSqlException

      @ExceptionHandler(java.sql.SQLException.class) public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView handleSqlException​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req, java.lang.Exception ex)
      Exception handler for an SQLException in SettingsController
      Parameters:
      req - the request the exception ooccured during
      ex - the exception thrown
      Returns:
      a model and view object for the settings page with an error message
